title: btcethgold
author: btcethgold
content: Hello All Friends,I have BTCs in my Trezor Wallet,Today i first checked if i am able to send btc to exchange successfully or not.I sent 0.03 BTC to my binance address. This went smoothly. but to my shock there was one more transaction created along with this transaction with BTC 1.06 going to another address.now when i check my BTC address on blockchain then it showed 1 BTC less but when i check my balance in Trezor then its shows full balance.how is it possible.please help me in understanding it. though i have asked the same in trezor forum too.

comments.author: OmegaStarScream
comments.body: QuoteI sent 0.03 BTC to my binance address. This went smoothly. but to my shock there was one more transaction created along with this transaction with BTC 1.06 going to another address.Do you mean there's another address in the same transaction or a completely new transaction with another ID?If the former, then it's probably a change address that also belongs to your wallet. It's nothing to be worried about.

comments.author: btcethgold
comments.created_time: March 28, 2023, 03:47:16 PMLast edit: March 28, 2023, 10:27:43 PM by Mr. Big
comments.body: Thanks a million my friend.i m feeling very relaxed. but could you tell me where can i read more about this function.as i again sent 0.1 btc then again it created another transaction with BTC 1.06Â its new address in same transaction.one 0.03 going to my binance account and one BTC to new address.

comments.author: OmegaStarScream
comments.body: Quote from: btcethgold on March 28, 2023, 03:47:16 PMThanks a million my friend.i m feeling very relaxed. but could you tell me where can i read more about this function.Check this article[1] and just to be sure, you can check your change addresses using Electrum[2][3] if you want since Trezor suite doesn't show them.[1] https://www.exodus.com/support/article/109-what-are-change-addresses[2] https://trezor.io/learn/a/what-is-a-change-address[3] https://trezor.io/learn/a/electrum-and-trezor

comments.author: btcethgold
comments.body: Thanks. so with every sending transaction its creating one more transaction of BTC of 1.06 though my trezor showing full amount.

comments.author: Freddie Boyer
comments.body: Quote from: btcethgold on March 28, 2023, 03:54:44 PMThanks. so with every sending transaction its creating one more transaction of BTC of 1.06 though my trezor showing full amount.It is possible that this is an error or glitch in the system. However, given the discrepancy between the amount shown on the blockchain and the amount shown in your Trezor wallet. Have you contacted Trezor support and reported the problem. I think They may be able to help you recover your funds or provide guidance on how to proceed.

comments.author: btcethgold
comments.body: Thanks mate.Actually first i transferred 0.03 to my exchange address which was successful. but it also created one more transfer within same transaction of BTC 1.06 to another address.now my address in trezor, when checked in blockchain explorer showed 1.06 btc less so i got worried. but when i checked my trezor balance then i had full amount there.now to check again i tried to exchange 0.01 btc to eth within trezor itself. now again two transfers were created one with 0.01 and another with 1.06 btc.i have got eth in my trezor and the btc balance is also showing correct in trezor but that first address where i had all btcs now showing 2 btc less in blockchain explorer.but in trezor everything is showing as correct.i am sure this is something about changing address as my friend omega mentioned above.

comments.author: hZti
comments.body: Yes this is called the change adress and is how Bitcoin works. With your Trezor you are also in control of all the change addresses so there is no issue. If you want to send bitcoins again you will see the same happening again. If you look at mempool you will see that this is the same for all transactions
